Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Rudimentary \Ru`di*men"ta*ry\, a. [Cf. F. rudimentaire.] 1. Of or pertaining to rudiments; consisting in first principles; elementary; initial; as, rudimental essays. [1913 Webster]
2. (Biol.) Very imperfectly developed; in an early stage of development; embryonic. [1913 Webster]

rudimentary adj 1: being or involving basic facts or principles; "the fundamental laws of the universe"; "a fundamental incompatibility between them"; "these rudimentary truths"; "underlying principles" [syn: {fundamental}, {underlying}] 2: being in the earliest stages of development; "rudimentary plans" 3: not fully developed in mature animals; "rudimentary wings" [syn: {vestigial}]
